intro: Oreoporanthera alpina, commonly known as the alpine oreoporanthera, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, alpine environments, where it adapts to cold temperatures and strong winds. Its small, showy flowers are often white or pale blue, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oreoporanthera alpina is an important component of alpine ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability in its habitat.
